Left memorizing times of this item:
In which year did The World War II break out?

Universal Memorizing Assistant is an app that helps you to memorize things.

　　 It will create a folder named U_Memorizing in the root dictionary of your phone storage, and use .xls files as books for storing your memorizing content.

　　 You can create, delete and edit your book files through either your phone or your PC.

　　 An example file has been generated for you to understand how to use this app. You can always regenerate it by clicking this button:

\u3000\u3000 If you are an experienced computer/phone user and familiar with this kind of apps, the content above will be enough for you to use this app.\n\n\u3000\u3000 If not or you are interested in more details, you can continue reading the content below.

Universal Memorizing Assistant is an app that you can use it in many conditions concerning memorizing, like learning a second language, memorizing answers to questions and so on. 

　　 Here is some of its usage:

 　　 - Memorizing words that are not likely to find in a dictionary:
\n\u3000\u3000 - Memorizing sentences that you want to use as motto:\n

The biggest difference between this app and other word/sentence-memorizing app is that in this app you will custom your memorizing content completely.

 　　 This may be quite useful when you are about to memorizing a lot of items that created by yourself.

This app use the .xls file as a storage to store your data to memorize (sorry that .xlsx is not supported yet), each file is called a "book" in this app, represent a book you will memorize.
 
　　 You can edit your .xls file in your PC and use it in your phone, through this app, which I think is the most convenient way to make your own book and use it:
\n\u3000\u3000 while you can also edit your book through this app:\n
\n\u3000\u3000 A folder named U_Memorizing will be created in your phone storage in the root dictionary, and all the .xls files in this folder will be scanned as books to use.\n

So when you have created a book file in your PC and want to use it in this app, move it into this folder. And if you want to backup your books, back up this folder.
 
　　 Note that a file named "BookData.xml" will also be created here, which stores all your book data, like progress and targeting memorizing times. DO NOT delete it if your are not about to reset all your book progress.

In a book file, only the first sheet is used. The first row is reserved as title, when editing your own book, you can leave it blank(it will be staffed automatically when using this book) or staff it if you like. 

　　 The first three columns of a book represents hint,answer,and left memorizing times.
 
　　 When editing a book file, it is recommended make sure the hint and answer is not blank(though they are also being staffed if left blank).
 
　　 As to left memorizing times, you can set it if you like, or it will be staffed with default value, 5, when using this book.

By default, each item of a book will be memorized 5 times, you can change this in the settings page.
 
　　 when memorizing, if you choose "I can recite this", the left times of this item will decrease by 1 time, or it will increase by 1 time(but will not exceed the max target memorizing times you have set).
 
　　 After every item in a book has been memorized for your targeting times, you will be noted that you have finished this book. You can choose another one or re-memorize this if you want.
 
　　 Of course you can also change your present memorizing book, and all your process will be saved.

As english is not my native language, I am pretty sure there must be some *bugs* in my expressions above, but I am fine with them and I will not *crash* for them, I hope you are still all right for now too. :p 
 
　　 Anyway, thanks for your reading. And sorry for your reading.
